functions
Interface Function

All Known Implementing Classes:
CrossedRidgeFunction, Function.SimpleFunction, RadialFunction, RadialSineFunction, SineFunction, SineFunction2, SineInSineFunction
public interface Function

This is the general function interface. If you want to implement your own function, take a look at the two convenience classes SimpleFunction and CompositeFunction.

You can add your function to the FunctionFactory to access it via the "xcsf_functions.ini".

Author:
Patrick O. Stalph, Martin V. Butz

Nested Class Summary
static class Function.SimpleFunction
          * This class encapsulates methods for simple testfunctions with 1-dimensional output.

Method Detail

nextProblemInstance

StateDescriptor nextProblemInstance()
Returns the next problem instance for XCSF to learn. For theoretical problems this will usually be a randomly generated input and the corresponding scaled (and possibly noisy) output.

Returns:
The next problem instance
See Also:
StateDescriptor

noiselessFunctionValue

double[] noiselessFunctionValue()
Returns the function value(s) as a double vector without noise. The function value refers to the last problem input instance generated.

Returns:
The noiseless function value(s)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no problem instance is generated, yet.

getConditionInputDimension

int getConditionInputDimension()
Returns the condition input dimension.

Returns:
the dimension of the condition input space.

getPredictionInputDimension

int getPredictionInputDimension()
Returns the prediction input dimension.

Returns:
the dimension of the prediction input space.

getOutputDimension

int getOutputDimension()
Returns the function output dimension.

Returns:
the dimension of the function output space.
